page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content: Sutton Hall a large house standing in 10 hectares, was converted into 8 timeshare flats in 1982, 3 cottages in the grounds are also used in this way. The flats which sleep 4 cost between Â£1200 & Â£5000 to buy for 1 week a year for 20 years. Most owners are from the W.Riding but some are American(They are interested in James Herriot the author who lives nearby).The owners often eat at the village pub and papers and groceries are bought from the village shop. In the extensive grounds there are tennis courts and a croquet lawn. There is an indoor swimming pool and a jaccuzzi. 3 businessmen own the Hall,2 live in the village. 1 gardener & cleaner work full-time, and there are 5 part-time cleaners, one lives in the village.2 owners' wives work in the reception.
